metadata.title: CVE-2015-6242 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The wmem_block_split_free_chunk function inepan/wmem/wmem_allocator_block.c in the wmem block allocator in the memorymanager in Wireshark 1.12.x before 1.12.7 does not properly consider acertain case of multiple realloc operations that restore a memory chunk toits original size, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (incorrect free operation and application crash) via a craftedpacket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6242` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1').
